article.headline: Sam Houston St. 68, Fresno St. 57
article.story: HUNTSVILLE, Texas (AP) -- Shamir McDaniel and Ryan Bright each had a double-double to lead Sam Houston State past Fresno State 68-57 Saturday night. McDaniel had 13 points and 11 rebounds, and Bright added 11 points and a game-high 14 boards for the Bearkats (4-0). McDaniel also had five assists and three steals, while Bright contributed three assists and two blocks. DeLuis Ramirez led Sam Houston with 14 points, and James Barrett was the fourth player in double figures with 11. The Bulldogs (3-3) shot just 28 percent for the game, including 3-of-24 from 3-point range. Hector Hernandez led Fresno State with 17 points and nine rebounds. Fresno trailed by five at halftime but pulled within a point at 36-35 early in the second half. Barrett answered with a layup to keep Sam Houston in front.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
